metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2131 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: Format string vulnerability in the rrdtool module 1.4.7 for Python, as used in Zenoss, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via format string specifiers to the rrdtool.graph function.

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> xenial was patched in release version 1.4.8-1, and later it was upgraded to the new upstream version 1.5 that already has the fix (no need to add an explict patch). Since then, every Ubuntu release already has the fix applied.

criterions.comment: rrdtool: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
